title: Moses
comment: One of the most important figures in the OT. Moses was called by God to lead Israel out of captivity in Egypt through the Sinai wilderness to the brink of the promised land. He was the mediator of the old covenant, and in several major respects anticipates the person of Jesus Christ.

children.title: Moses, life of
children.comment: The life of Moses sets the scene for the great events of the exodus from Egypt, and the showing forth of the power of the LORD, culminating in the giving of the covenant at Sinai and the preparations for entry into the promised land.

Moses, significance of
children.comment: Moses performed a number of major roles in the history of Israel. Many of these roles later found their perfection in Jesus Christ.

Moses, foreshadower of Jesus Christ
children.comment: Moses foreshadows Jesus Christ in his role as a law-giver, as a mediator between God and his people and as a prophet who declared the will of God. In these matters, Jesus Christ brought to perfection the work begun through Moses.

secondaryrefs.comment: Moses, like Jesus Christ, had no settled home in his own country.
